about.title: HTTP Requests in Multiple Languages
about.subtitle: See how to make HTTP requests across different programming languages. From Node.js with fetch and axios, to Python with requests and httpx, Go with net/http. Each example shows POST requests with JSON payloads and proper headers.

code.code:
# Python HTTP request using requests library
import requests

# POST request
response = requests.post(
    'https://api.example.com/data',
    json={
        'name': 'John Doe',
        'email': 'john@example.com'
    },
    headers={
        'Authorization': 'Bearer your-token-here'
    }
)

print(f'Status Code: {response.status_code}')
print(f'Response: {response.json()}')

# Alternative using httpx (async)
import httpx
import asyncio

async def make_request():
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        response = await client.post(
            'https://api.example.com/data',
            json={'name': 'John Doe', 'email': 'john@example.com'},
            headers={'Authorization': 'Bearer your-token-here'}
        )
        return response.json()

# asyncio.run(make_request())
